gov.ornl.keva.table

Class TableBucket

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.ornl.keva.table.TableValue
      • gov.ornl.keva.table.TableBucket
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SortedBucket, UnsafeBucket

    public abstract class TableBucket
extends TableValue
    A table bucket keeps track of a history of independent values. A table key is associated with a single bucket. Users may choose from different implementations of buckets, depending on the constraints the user wishes to place on the values.
    Author:
    James Horey

    • Nested Class Summary

      Bucket implementation constraints.

      • commit

        public abstract boolean commit(TableValue value,
             java.lang.String branch)
        Commit the value identified by vector clock and branch.
        Parameters:
        value - Table value to commit
        branch - Specific branch where the value resides (optional)

      • add

        public abstract void add(TableValue value,
       java.lang.String branch)
        Add a new value to this bucket to a specific branch. This means that the vector clock associated with the value should be appended to the branch vector clock.
        Parameters:
        value - Table value to add to bucket
        branch - Specific branch where the value resides (optional)

      • add

        public abstract void add(TableValue value)
        Add a new value to this bucket. The value is added using the vector clock associated with the value.
        Parameters:
        value - Table value to add to bucket

      • addAll

        public abstract void addAll(java.util.Collection<TableValue> values)
        Bulk add the values supplied into this bucket.
        Parameters:
        values - Tables values to add to bucket

        Lock the bucket to all writes.

      • unlockBucket

        public abstract void unlockBucket()
        Unlock the bucket to all writes.

      • size

        public abstract long size()
        Return number of entries in the bucket. Useful to check if additional items have been added after compaction/flushing.
        Overrides:
        size in class TableValue
        Returns:
        Number of bucket elements

        Get the memory usage of the entire bucket.

        Returns:

      • getClock

        public abstract VectorClock getClock()
        Return the vector clock for this bucket. The clock is a merger of all the subclocks.
        Overrides:
        getClock in class TableValue
        Returns:
        Merged vector clock

        public abstract java.util.Iterator<VectorClock> getAllClocks()
        Return an iterattor of vector clocks from each of the data values in the bucket.

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getComplete(PruneOptions pruneOptions)
        Used to iterate over all the values across all the branches.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getUncollapsed

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getUncollapsed(java.lang.String branch,
                                                                        PruneOptions pruneOptions)
        Return the historical list of values from the supplied branch name.
        Parameters:
        branch - Specific branch where the value resides
        pruneOptions - Options to restrict viewing particular values (e.g., deletes)
        Returns:
        Iterator over table values

      • getCollapsed

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,StreamIterator<TableValue>> getCollapsed()
        Iterate over the set of independent values. Each independent value is collapsed so that only the latest value is returned.
        Returns:
        Iterator over table values

      • setClock

        public void setClock(VectorClock clock)
        Normally used by the TableValue to set the clock for a value. However, the clock for buckets are derived, so we do not support this operation.
        Overrides:
        setClock in class TableValue
        Parameters:
        clock - Vector clock
